keywords.name: TestKeyword
keywords.definition: TestKeyword definition

keywords.name: Impact X
keywords.definition: During the Modify Attack Dice step, if the defending unit has the Heavy Armor or Armor X keyword, a unit whose attack pool includes a weapon that has the Impact X keyword can modify up to X hit results to critical hit results for that attack

keywords.name: Armor X
keywords.definition: During the Modify Attack Dice step of the attack sequence, if the defending unit has the Armor X keyword, the defending player may cancel up to X non-critical hit results, removing those dice from the Attack Pool.

keywords.name: Arsenal X
keywords.definition: When choosing weapons during the Form Attack Pool step, each element in the unit that has the Arsenal X keyword can contribute X weapons to attack pools. Each weapon or combination of weapons may form a new attack pool, but each weapon may only be added to 1 attack pool. Weapons with the same name do not have to be in the same attack pool.

keywords.name: Towering
keywords.definition: When drawing line of sight for an attack to or from a unit with this keyword, the attacker may ignore one other unit or non-Elevated terrain within range 1 of the attacker when determining if a base is obscured.

keywords.name: Plodding
keywords.definition: A unit with the Plodding keyword can only make 1 Move action during its Activation.

keywords.name: Heavy Armor
keywords.definition: During the Modify Attack Dice step of the attack sequence, if the defending unit has the Heavy Armor keyword, the defending player cancels all non-critical hit results, removing those dice from the Attack Pool .

keywords.name: Nimble
keywords.definition: After a unit that has the Nimble keyword defends against an attack, if it spent at least 1 dodge token during any point of the attack sequence, it gains 1 dodge token.

keywords.name: Transport X
keywords.definition: You may Transport X friendly trooper (non-creature) units. This value applies per element in your unit. Transport 1 units with 2 elements can ferry up to 2 trooper units. You may choose to deploy trooper units inside eligible transports.

keywords.name: Stationary
keywords.definition: A unit with the Stationary keyword cannot make Moves unless the Move is a Pivot. This unit is allowed to make 2 actions instead of 1 during the activation phase. Units with the Stationary keyword may be deployed within 3‚Äù outside of your deployment zone.

keywords.name: Direct X
keywords.definition: Each Command Phase, during the Issue Orders step, a unit with the Direct keyword may issue an order to X friendly units at range 2 that has the unit name or unit type specified.

keywords.name: Inspire X
keywords.definition: When a unit with the Inspire X keyword ends its Activation, remove up to X total Suppression tokens from other allied units at Range 2.

keywords.name: Compel
keywords.definition: After another allied Trooper unit of the matching Rank or unit type within range 2 of an allied unit with the Compel keyword Rallies, at the start of its Make Actions step, it may gain 1 Suppression token to make a free Move action.

keywords.name: Spotter X
keywords.definition: As an action, a unit with the Spotter X keyword can choose up to X friendly units at range 2. Each chosen unit gains an aim token.

keywords.name: Immune: Effect
keywords.definition: A unit with the Immune: Effect keyword ignores all enemy effects associated with the effect type.

keywords.name: Disciplined X
keywords.definition: After a unit with the Disciplined X keyword is issued an Order, it may remove up to X Suppression tokens.

keywords.name: Precise X
keywords.definition: When an attacking unit that has the Precise X keyword spends an aim token during the Reroll Attack Dice step, it can reroll up to X additional attack dice per aim token spent.

keywords.name: Loiter
keywords.definition: Aerial vehicles with the Loiter keyword are not required to make compulsory moves nor are they removed from the battlefield at the end phase. They activate and deploy like typical units would.

keywords.name: Low Profile
keywords.definition: When a unit with the Low Profile keyword would roll 1 or more defense dice during the Roll Cover Pool step, it rolls 1 fewer defense die and instead adds an additional critical save result to the Cover Pool after rolling, giving it one free successful cover roll.

keywords.name: Scout
keywords.definition: After an undeployed unit with the Scout keyword deploys, it may perform a free move action, ignoring difficult terrain.

keywords.name: Shields X
keywords.definition: During the Modify Defense Dice step of the attack sequence, if the defending unit has the Shields X keyword, the defending player may reroll up to X defense dice. If the attack pool contains a weapon with the Ion keyword, no dice may be rerolled by the Shields X keyword.

keywords.name: Fixed: Rear
keywords.definition: To add a weapon that has the Fixed: Front or Fixed: Rear keyword to an attack pool, the defending unit must have at least one of its miniature‚Äôs bases partially inside the specified firing arc of the attacking miniature. Vehicles are assumed to have Fixed: Front on all their weapons unless stated otherwise.

keywords.name: Ion X
keywords.definition: A vehicle or droid unit that suffers wounds after defending against an attack that includes a weapon with the Ion X keyword gains X Ion tokens. At the start of a unit‚Äôs activation, roll 1 defense die for each Ion token attached to that unit. On a roll result of 5+, remove 1 Ion token. A unit may not attack if it has 1 or more Ion tokens attached to it. Units with the Shields X keyword may not re-roll defense dice using its effect when a weapon with the Ion X keyword is present in the attack pool.

keywords.name: Tow Cable
keywords.definition: After a Walker unit is wounded by an attack that includes this weapon, it gains a vehicle damage token if it does not already have one. Then, the attacker may pivot the defender up to 90¬∞.

keywords.name: Deflect
keywords.definition: While a unit with the Deflect keyword defends against a Ranged attack, it converts critical fail roll results to critical saves. Additionally, during the Roll Defense Dice step, before converting roll results, the attacker suffers 1 Wound if there is at least 1 critical fail roll result in the defense roll. While defending against an attack made only with weapons that have the High Velocity keyword, the Deflect keyword has no effect.

keywords.name: Swivel
keywords.definition: To add a weapon with the Swivel keyword to an attack pool, the defending unit must have at least one of its element‚Äôs bases partially inside any arc of the attacking vehicle, including the front or rear. This keyword represents a fully rotating turret or flexible firing mount, and overrides the standard restriction that vehicle weapons may only target through the front arc. Weapons with Swivel may trace line of sight and fire from either the front or rear arc of the vehicle.

keywords.name: Pierce
keywords.definition: If an attacking unit attacks with a weapon with the Pierce keyword it increases the defending unit‚Äôs Defense stat to 6+ for the duration of that attack.

keywords.name: Blast
keywords.definition: During the Apply Cover step, a defending unit cannot use cover to cancel hit results produced by an attack pool that contains dice added by a weapon with the Blast keyword.

keywords.name: Suppressive
keywords.definition: When a unit defends against an Attack Pool that has Suppressive, it gains 1 additional Suppression token during the Assign Suppression Token to Defender step.

keywords.name: Indirect
keywords.definition: When making an attack with a weapon that has the Indirect keyword, follow these rules: The attack ignores all blocking terrain and other units when tracing line of sight. If no friendly unit is both at Range 2 and has line of sight to the defending unit, the attack is considered unguided. In this case, the attack only hits on critical hits (results of 8). If any friendly unit is at Range 2 and has line of sight to the defending unit, the attack proceeds normally, using the weapon‚Äôs listed to-hit value. Weapons with the Indirect keyword may not target Aerial vehicles.

keywords.name: Lock-On
keywords.definition: When the defender is an aerial vehicle unit type, weapons with the Lock-On keyword have a -1 bonus to hit and aerial vehicles do not benefit from cover.

keywords.name: Reinforced
keywords.definition: A unit with the Reinforced keyword has the following effects: The unit‚Äôs cohesion distance increases to Range 1 instead of the standard ¬Ω Range. When rallying, this unit saves on a 4+ instead. This unit gains +1 to its courage value. Reinforced units count as 2 units for the purposes of Transport X.

keywords.name: Unhindered
keywords.definition: You ignore the effects of difficult terrain.

keywords.name: Spray
keywords.definition: When a unit adds a weapon that has the Spray keyword to the attack pool, that weapon contributes its dice a number of times equal to the number of miniatures in the defending unit.

keywords.name: Critical X
keywords.definition: When a unit rolls attack pool with the Critical X keyword, during the Convert Attack Dice step it may convert up to X critical miss roll results (1) to critical hit results (8).
